caption.p: Principal components analysis (PCA) illustrating the variation in the seven climate variables ( table 1) across our study period. ( a) Vectors for individual climate variables associated with the first two PCA axes (i.e. dimensions, labelled ‘dim’); ( b) the percentage contributions of each variable to the first three PCA axes. ( c, d) The positions for each year on the first two axes; the size of the text reflects the relative size of the consensus year (i.e. the number of species experiencing an extreme population change) in either the year during which the population change was measured ( c) or in the previous year (i.e. accounting for a 1-year population lag, ( d)).
